results.name: Number of ways to write n as the sum of 3 positive palindromes.
comment: Conjecture: a(n) > 0 for n > 2, i.e., every number greater than 2 can be written as the sum of 3 positive palindromes.
link: Giovanni Resta, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
example: a(28) = 5 since 28 can be expressed in 5 ways as the sum of 3 positive palindromes, namely, 28 = 22+5+1 = 22+4+2 = 22+3+3 = 11+11+6 = 11+9+8.
